name: BFGoodrich Long Trail T/A Tour Tire P245/70R17 108T

reviews.name: BFGoodrich Long Trail T/A Tour Tire P245/70R17 108T
reviews.reviewText: Well Worth The money! Constantly on the road due to my job. Have put about 70,000 on the tires and just now going to get new ones. Definite Buy!
reviews.title: 12 July 2011

reviews.name: BFGoodrich Long Trail T/A Tour Tire P245/70R17 108T
reviews.reviewText: i have had this brand for 6 years on my suv and i won't have any other. I have 63,000 miles on those tires and am about ready to purchase a new set. But after taking a 2nd look at them I think I can go a while longer, they are that great. Can go wrong with this purchase.
reviews.title: best tire ever!

reviews.name: BFGoodrich Long Trail T/A Tour Tire P245/70R17 108T
reviews.reviewText: I bought my tires on 12/23/08 and I now have 78,000 miles and I going to buy 4 more now. Just rotate and balance ever 5,000 miles. They increase in price by 20.00 per tire. That ok I know what I'm getting.
reviews.title: Melvin

reviews.name: BFGoodrich Long Trail T/A Tour Tire P245/70R17 108T
reviews.reviewText: I was amazed at the miles I got from the first set of these I bought -- in fact I thought -- oh, no - this can't be right??? But it was -- I have never had such performance from any set of tires ever and why would I even think of getting anything else again? These are on a Chevy Blazer that likes to run up and down the Florida Turnpike at 85 mph day after day. Another feature - they grip the road so well I can stop that SUV on a dime or make a hairpin turn without breaking traction. Think about it.
reviews.title: Second order of these

reviews.name: BFGoodrich Long Trail T/A Tour Tire P245/70R17 108T
reviews.reviewText:
The immediate predecessor of this tire (same exact name and rating, except the word "Radial" was used instead of "Tour") was standard equipment on my 2002 Hyundai Santa Fe All-wheel Drive Traction Control ABS SUV.

The tires are quiet, but grip the road quite well.

In fact, the handling of my Hyundai Santa Fe, with these tires, is better than the handling of my 1998 Volvo S70 Turbo with its "performance" Michelin tires, and that is saying a lot.

The "T/A Tour" tires reportedly are a little noisier than the "Radial T/A" tires. I think can live with that.

I presently have more than 55,000 miles on my first set of "Radial T/A" tires, and will be due for replacement within the next year. Not because the tires will be worn out, but just because they will then be thirteen years old.
reviews.title: Best SUV Tire
